question: A 6-year-old child has an accident and had fracture elbow, after 4 years presented with tingling and numbness in the ulnar side of finger, fracture is:
exp: (b) Dislocation of elbow- Fracture elbow with tingling subsequently after few years--"Tardy ulnar nerve palsy". Most common cause is fracture lateral condyle humerus.

question: Fracture shaft of humerus damages which nerve?
exp: ANSWER: (A) Radial nerveREF: Snell's anatomy 7th ed p. 484Radial nerve injury is seen in:Fracture shaft of humerusSaturday night palsyInjection palsyFeatures of radial nerve injury:Sensory loss over area supplied by posterior cutaneous nerve of forearm.Wrist, thumb and finger extension is lost.

question: Axillary nerve damage is caused by damage to?
exp: Ans. (b) Surgical neck humerusRef.'.Grant's atlas of anatomy, 12/e, p 524)

question: In fracture of surgical neck of humerus which nerve is involved?
exp: Ans. is 'a' i.e., Axillary Site of injuryNerve injuredFracture surgical neck humerusAxillary nerveFracture shaft humerusRadial nerveSupracondylar fractureMedian nerve (anterior interosseous branch)Medial epicondyle fractureUlnar nervePosterior dislocation of HIPSciatic nerveFibular neck fractureCommon peroneal nerve

question: Fracture shaft of humerus causes damage to?
exp: ANSWER: (D) Radial nerveREF: Keith and Moore's anatomy 4th ed p. 761Radial nerve injury is commonly associated with:Fracture shaft of humerusSaturday night palsyInjection palsy

question: Hanging cast is used for-
exp: Ans. is 'c' i.e.. Humerus fracture Name of the caseUseo Minerva castCervical spine diseaseo Risser's castScoliosiso Turn-buckle castScoliosiso Shoulder spicaShoulder immobilisationo U-slabFracture of the humeruso Hanging castFracture of the humeruso Code's castColles' fractureo Hip spicaFracture of the femuro Cylinder castFracture of the patellao PTB castFracture of the tibia

question: A patient had met with an accident and he can not abduct his right arm and can not lift it. On examination tenderness felt near right upper arm. X-ray showed fracture surgical neck of humerus. Muscle that was paralyzed was:
exp: (b) SupraspinatusThe best answer here is deltoid (axillary nerve) since it is not mentioned, so we choose supraspinatus (suprascapular nerve).

question: Which nerve is damaged in fracture surgical neck humerus -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i.e., Axillary Complications of fracture surgical neck humeruso Shoulder stiffness.o Axillary nerve is particularly vulnerable, both from the injury and from surgeryo Axillary artery injury o Malunion o Nonunion o Myositis ossificans
